snippet: In the Pakistani city of Quetta, relatives of scores of people killed in bomb attacks sat beside coffins in the street, refusing to bury their loved ones until they received assurance the state would protect them.
abstract: In the Pakistani city of Quetta, relatives of scores of people killed in bomb attacks sat beside coffins in the street, refusing to bury their loved ones until they received assurance the state would protect them.

headline.main: Activists Document Sit-In by Families of Bombing Victims in Pakistan
